column4: hi guys need help to connect my ubuntu 10.04 with the wireless
do you know whether you have the drivers installed for your wireless card?
on a new install these drivers are often not included by default
why don't you give us a ls pastebin from inside the compat-wireless directory?
that's from within your home directory, not the compat-wireless one
can install teamviewer and access to my system
I'm not familar with linux , can u plz guid me step by step
download  here and access to my system
this is a best guess, if you'd rather wait for Si2100 to get back that's fine.  I think you need to open a terminal, "cd compat-wireless-3.2-rc1-1", "sudo make install"
you should reboot and check if it works.  I need to go in a minute, good luck
ok just tell me how to check it when reboot
click the wireless icon and see if you can see your router.
or whatever wireless device you were trying to find in the first place
